summary: The Revitalizing Rural Communities Act of 2025 aims to extend and increase funding for the Rural Economic Development Loan and Grant Program of the Department of Agriculture. The bill amends the Rural Electrification Act of 1936, specifically section 313B, to provide $12,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2026 through 2030, replacing the previous allocation of $10,000,000 for fiscal years 2019 through 2023. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on September 26, 2025.
